intro: Lecanorchis japonica var. kiiensis, commonly known as the Kii mountain orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to Japan. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its delicate, greenish-yellow flowers and slender, grass-like leaves. This plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is known for its intricate floral structure and specialized pollination mechanisms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
